title: How to Use a Wired Connection to Connect Your Wii With the Internet

steps.headline: Plug the Ethernet end of your connection into an open Ethernet port on your Switch, Hub, Router or Gateway.
Connect the USB end to the back of your Wii.
steps.description: It should look like a plain rectangle.

steps.headline: From the Wii Settings in your Wii Menu (lower-left corner), select internet settings.
steps.description: Ethernet connections do not require security setting adjustments in Wii configuration, so simply enabling the wired connection from Wii settings should be enough to get you connected.

text: Plug the Ethernet end of your connection into an open Ethernet port on your Switch, Hub, Router or Gateway.  Connect the USB end to the back of your Wii. It should look like a plain rectangle. From the Wii Settings in your Wii Menu (lower-left corner), select internet settings. Ethernet connections do not require security setting adjustments in Wii configuration, so simply enabling the wired connection from Wii settings should be enough to get you connected.
